bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 28, 1916

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to participate in the meetings of the National Malarial Committee and the American Society of Tropical Medicine, as well as to continue his investigation of impounded waters.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, April 28, 1916
div1.opener:
FAD
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
April 28, 1916.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital, Baltimore, Md.
Sir:
div1.p:
At the request of the State Commissioner of Health of
Virginia, you are hereby detailed to deliver an address on
malaria at the meeting to be held by the Virginia Public
Health Association at Newport News, May 8-9, 1916.

You will leave Newport News in time to reach Washington
and participate at the meeting of the National Malarial Com-
mittee at 1.00 P.M., May 10. Subsequently you will attend such
sessions of the meeting of the American Society of Tropical
Medicine, May 10-11, as may be practicable. You will then
confer with the Bureau relative to the inspection of certain
Gulf quarantine stations, and proceed to Pascagoula, Gulfport,
and Gulf quarantine station, Ship Island, Miss., for the pur-
pose of inspecting the operations of the Service at those ports.

Upon the completion of this duty you will take up your
investigations relative to impounded waters and the prevalence
of malaria in the states of South Carolina, Georgia and Alabama,
-2-
referred to in another order of this date.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue,
Surgeon-General. WES

The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing in-
structions are hereby authorized.
B R Newton
Assistant Secretary.
